name: infinite_hell
author: 陈旭磊
complexity: O(n^{3/4}) for single-point evaluation with optimized recursion and O(n log n) for prefix computation via difference DP.
summary: The problem asks to count the number of ways to partition integers 1 to n into three unordered sets such that no two elements from different sets have their sum in the third set. The solution involves deep combinatorial observations, number-theoretic reasoning (especially gcd and modular structure), and optimized dynamic programming using Möbius inversion and number-theoretic sieving techniques.
